result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse M. Ponyicsanyi was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Arresting Agency: JCSD

  Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

Case called at 340pm [mo]
Defendant Jesse M. Ponyicsanyi in court with Attorney Stephen Michael Govin.   ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Hall motions for the Amendment of Counts #1 and #3 as portrayed in the Criminal Case Settlement; gives basis
--The Court grants this motion to amend Counts#1 and #3

  Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Amended Counts #1 and #3; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #5.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Ponyicsanyi

On Amended Counts #1 and #3, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:

--On each count, concurrent, to serve 30 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence on    12/17 /15 at 9:00pm.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening (at least once per month for first three months)
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol 
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--no possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription
--No Contact with Charles Rush
--No contact with any known drug offender except for treatment, per Agent
--On Count #1: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #3:  to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--to pay drug testing fee in the amount of $50 (joint and several with Charles Rush)
--to pay buy money reimbursement in the amount of $120(joint and several with Charles Rush)



Days credit for time already served:  0 days
recess: 4:04pm

Case called at 10:02am [mo]
Defendant Jesse M. Ponyicsanyi in court with Attorney Stephen Michael Govin.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance

Atty. Govin indicates that resolution is near, gives summary of possible resolution; indicates that conditional jail is suggested and requests that this not begin until Mr. Ponyicsanyi is on Winter Break from college,  requests plea and sentencing date.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling
recess:10:07am

NEXT: Plea/ Sentencing on 10/20/15 at 3:00pm
The Court rescinds it's prior order granted substitution
Court concludes the request is timely and in the proper form. The Court directs the assignment of another judge under Wis. Stat. 971.20

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 1:26pm [mo]
Defendant Jesse M. Ponyicsanyi in court with attorney Stephen Michael Govin.  DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court verifies date of birth and address on criminal complaint
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2500  Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--no possession of drug paraphernalia 
--no contact with Charles Rush
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking
recess: 2:34pm
